question.p: What was a rude shock for Matteo?

p.b: eating a roll or something light for lunch at school
In Italy he finishes school at 1pm. He goes home for a hot lunch, then he has time to rest, do homework and go out.

question.p: What comments does he make about water?

p.b: It%27s never on the table. Mineral water is not very common and is expensive.

question.p: What does he notice about mixing food?

p.b: Foods are mixed %2D pasta with milk. Cappuccino is drunk after dinner. In Italy it is drunk only in the morning.

question.p: What does his Australian family do with leftovers?

p.b: They have them for lunch or dinner the next day.

question.p: How is this different from what happens in Italy?

p.b: His mother always prepares fresh meals.

question.p: What comments does Matteo make about the spaghetti he eats in Australia?

p.b: He often eats spaghetti but the dishes are not very authentic.

question.p: Matteo is astonished to find so many pizzeria and Italian restaurants in Australia. What is his explanation for this?

p.b: Perhaps because Italian cuisine is very good. He personally thinks that it is the best in the world.
